Class Car

  • java.lang.Object
    • Car
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Car>

    public class Car
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Car>
    The Car class is an object that stores the given width, height and allowed movement directions of any car in the game.
    Since:
    20-09-2016
    Author:
    ElanVB

      This method is used to get the unique ID of the Car.
      java.lang.String getStringDirections(boolean[] directions)
      This method converts the boolean array describing the directions the car may move in into a string, this is mostly used for toString and debugging.

      This method is used to get the width of the Car.

      This method is used to check if the Car is allowed to move down.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Car

        public Car(int width,
           int height,
           java.lang.String directions)
        This is the Class Constructor for the Car object.
        Parameters:
        width - The number of columns the car will span.
        height - The number of rows the car will span
        directions - The directions the car may move in.

    • Method Detail

      • mayMoveDown

        public boolean mayMoveDown()
        This method is used to check if the Car is allowed to move down.
        Returns:
        True if car may move down, false otherwise.

        This method is used to check if the Car is allowed to move left.
        Returns:

        This method is used to check if the Car is allowed to move up.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Car otherCar)
        This method is used to give an ordering to cars.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Car>
        Returns:
        0 if the cars are equal, 1 if this car is greater than otherCar, -1 otherwise.

      • getStringDirections

        public java.lang.String getStringDirections(boolean[] directions)
        This method converts the boolean array describing the directions the car may move in into a string, this is mostly used for toString and debugging.
        Parameters:
        directions - The boolean array describing the directions the car may.
        Returns:
        A string containing the directions the car may move in.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        This method is used to get the width of the Car.
        Returns:
        The width of the car.

      • resetId

        public static void resetId()
        This method is used to reset the unique ID counter. This must be done if multiple between each creation of a new board.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method converts the information that defines this car into a string.
        Overrides:

        Returns:
